citation.article-title: Nubsella zeaxanthinifaciens gen. nov., sp. nov., a zeaxanthin-producing bacterium of the family Sphingobacteriaceae isolated from freshwater.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Nubsella (Nub.sel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Nubsella arbitrary name derived from the acronym NUBS for Nihon University College of Bioresource Sciences, where the type species was first isolated).
MK-7 is the only respiratory quinone.
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Nubsella is a member of the family Sphingobacteriaceae.
The G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 38.6 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Nubsella zeaxanthinifaciens.
